title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others‚Äô private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement songqi.duan@outlook.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla‚Äôs code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Songqi Duan. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Duan S (2023). catplot: Capable Tity Plot Tools. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://github.com/zerostwo/catplot.
code: @Manual{,   title = {catplot: Capable And Tity Plot Tools},   author = {Songqi Duan},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://github.com/zerostwo/catplot}, }

title: Capable And Tity Plot Tools
text: catplot capable tity data visualization tool maintained Songqi Duan.

title: Capable And Tity Plot Tools
text: Install latest version GitHub follow:
code: if (!require(devtools)) install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("zerostwo/catplot")

title: Capable And Tity Plot Tools
code: library(catplot) library(ggplot2)  data("iris") p <- ggplot(   data = iris,   aes(     x = Species,     y = Sepal.Length   ) ) +   geom_boxplot() +   theme_cat(     aspect_ratio = 1,     show_panel_grid = "both",     show_title = "y"   ) p

title: Capable And Tity Plot Tools
text: Please note catplot project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

what: Create a dimensionality reduction plot for categorical data ‚Äî cat_dimplot
title: Create a dimensionality reduction plot for categorical data ‚Äî cat_dimplot
text: function creates dimensionality reduction plot categorical data using Seurat ggplot2. allows selection reduction method, grouping, splitting variables, well visualization labels, rasterization, color palette. cat_dimplot() function intended used wrapper around Seurat's DimPlot() function.

title: Create a dimensionality reduction plot for categorical data ‚Äî cat_dimplot
code: cat_dimplot(   object,   dims = c(1, 2),   cells = NULL,   cols = NULL,   pt_size = 1,   reduction = NULL,   group_by = NULL,   split_by = NULL,   shape_by = NULL,   order = NULL,   shuffle = FALSE,   seed = 1,   label = FALSE,   label_size = 8 * 0.36,   label_color = "black",   label_box = FALSE,   repel = TRUE,   cells_highlight = NULL,   cols_highlight = "#DE2D26",   sizes_highlight = 1,   na_value = "grey50",   ncol = NULL,   combine = TRUE,   raster = TRUE,   raster_dpi = c(512, 512),   show_legend = TRUE,   show_axis = TRUE,   show_border = TRUE,   title = NULL,   palette = "Paired",   ... )

title: Create a dimensionality reduction plot for categorical data ‚Äî cat_dimplot
text: object Seurat object containing categorical data. dims dimensions plot. Default c(1, 2). cells cells plot. Default NULL. cols columns plot. Default NULL. pt_size size points plot. Default 1. reduction dimensionality reduction method. Default NULL. group_by variable group data . Default NULL. split_by variable split data . Default NULL. shape_by variable shape data . Default NULL. order order plot data . Default NULL. shuffle Logical value indicating whether shuffle data plotting. Default FALSE. seed random seed use shuffling data. Default 1. label Logical value indicating whether show labels plot. Default FALSE. label_size size labels plot. Default 8 * 0.36. label_color color labels plot. Default "black". label_box Logical value indicating whether show box around labels plot. Default FALSE. repel Logical value indicating whether use point repulsion avoid overlapping labels. Default TRUE. cells_highlight cells highlight plot. Default NULL. cols_highlight columns highlight plot. Default NULL. sizes_highlight sizes highlight plot. Default NULL. na_value value use missing data. Default "grey50". ncol number columns use plot. Default NULL. combine Logical value indicating whether combine plots single plot. Default TRUE. raster Logical value indicating whether use rasterization improved performance. Default TRUE. raster_dpi DPI use rasterization. Default c(512, 512). show_legend Logical value indicating whether show legend plot. Default TRUE. show_axis Logical value indicating whether show axis plot. Default TRUE. show_border Logical value indicating whether show panel axis borders plot. Default TRUE. title title plot. Default NULL. palette color palette use plot. Default "Paired". ... Additional parameters passed DimPlot() function Seurat.

title: Create a dimensionality reduction plot for categorical data ‚Äî cat_dimplot
text: ggplot2 object containing dimensionality reduction plot.

title: Create a dimensionality reduction plot for categorical data ‚Äî cat_dimplot
code: if (FALSE) { library(Seurat) library(ggplot2) data("pbmc_small") pbmc_small <- CreateSeuratObject(counts = pbmc_small) Idents(pbmc_small) <- pbmc_small$percent.mt > 10 cat_dimplot(object = pbmc_small, reduction = "tsne", group_by = "ident", palette = "Set1") }

what: Plot a dot plot with categorical groups ‚Äî cat_dotplot
title: Plot a dot plot with categorical groups ‚Äî cat_dotplot
text: function plots dot plot categorical groups using DotPlot function Seurat package.

title: Plot a dot plot with categorical groups ‚Äî cat_dotplot
code: cat_dotplot(   x,   assay = NULL,   features,   col_min = -2.5,   col_max = 2.5,   dot_min = 0,   dot_scale = 4,   idents = NULL,   group_by = NULL,   split_by = NULL,   cluster_idents = FALSE,   scale = TRUE,   scale_by = "radius",   scale_min = NA,   scale_max = NA )

title: Plot a dot plot with categorical groups ‚Äî cat_dotplot
text: x Seurat object containing data plot. assay assay plot. Defaults default assay. features character vector feature names plot. col_min minimum value color scale. Defaults -2.5. col_max maximum value color scale. Defaults 2.5. dot_min minimum value dot size scale. Defaults 0. dot_scale size dots plot. idents character vector identities plot. Defaults identities. group_by character vector specifying grouping variable. Defaults "ident". split_by character vector specifying splitting variable. cluster_idents Whether cluster identities . Defaults FALSE. scale Whether scale dot size . Defaults TRUE. scale_by variable scale dot size . Defaults "radius". scale_min minimum value dot size scale. Defaults NA. scale_max maximum value dot size scale. Defaults NA.

title: Plot a dot plot with categorical groups ‚Äî cat_dotplot
text: ggplot2 object.

title: Plot a dot plot with categorical groups ‚Äî cat_dotplot
code: if (FALSE) { cat_dotplot(x = mySeuratObject, features = c("CD3D", "CD8A", "CD4")) }

what: Plot feature expression in reduced dimensions ‚Äî cat_featureplot
title: Plot feature expression in reduced dimensions ‚Äî cat_featureplot
text: function plots feature expression reduced dimensions using FeaturePlot function Seurat package.

title: Plot feature expression in reduced dimensions ‚Äî cat_featureplot
code: cat_featureplot(   object,   features,   reduction = NULL,   label = label,   split_by = NULL,   label_size = 8 * 0.36,   pt_size = 1,   slot = "data",   max_cutoff = NA,   raster = TRUE,   seed = 717,   title = NULL,   legend_title = NULL,   show_legend = TRUE,   show_axis = TRUE,   show_border = TRUE,   palette = "YlOrRd",   direction = 1,   ... )

title: Plot feature expression in reduced dimensions ‚Äî cat_featureplot
text: object Seurat object containing data plot. features character vector feature names plot. reduction character string specifying dimensionality reduction use (e.g., "PCA", "UMAP", "tSNE"). Defaults NULL. label character vector specifying labels use cell group. Defaults label. split_by character vector specifying cell groups split plot . Defaults NULL. label_size numeric value specifying size labels. Defaults 8 * 0.36. pt_size numeric value specifying size points. Defaults 1. slot character string specifying slot Seurat object use (e.g., "data", "scale.data", "integrated"). Defaults "data". max_cutoff numeric value specifying maximum expression cutoff. Defaults NA. raster logical value specifying whether use raster graphics. Defaults TRUE. seed integer value specifying random seed. Defaults 717. title character string specifying plot title. Defaults NULL. legend_title character string specifying legend title. Defaults NULL. show_legend logical value specifying whether show legend. Defaults TRUE. show_axis logical value specifying whether show plot axis. Defaults TRUE. show_border logical value specifying whether show plot border. Defaults TRUE. palette character string specifying color palette use. Defaults "YlOrRd". direction numeric value specifying direction color palette. Defaults 1. ... Additional parameters pass FeaturePlot.

title: Plot feature expression in reduced dimensions ‚Äî cat_featureplot
text: ggplot2 object.

title: Plot feature expression in reduced dimensions ‚Äî cat_featureplot
code: if (FALSE) { cat_featureplot(x = mySeuratObject, features = c("CD3D", "CD8A", "CD4"), reduction = "UMAP") }

what: Modify color aesthetics for categorical plots ‚Äî cat_modify_color
title: Modify color aesthetics for categorical plots ‚Äî cat_modify_color
text: function generates colors using generate_colors function applies manual scales color /fill aesthetics.

title: Modify color aesthetics for categorical plots ‚Äî cat_modify_color
code: cat_modify_color(   palette = "Paired",   n = NULL,   color_names = NULL,   modification = "go_lighter",   direction = 1,   aesthetics = "both" )

title: Modify color aesthetics for categorical plots ‚Äî cat_modify_color
text: palette character string specifying name color palette use. default value "Paired". Valid options include palette name recognized generate_colors function. n integer specifying number colors generate. default value NULL, generates default number colors based selected palette. color_names character vector specifying names individual colors palette. length vector number colors palette. default value NULL, assign names colors. modification character string specifying modification apply colors. default value "go_lighter". Valid options include "go_darker", "go_lighter", "go_both_ways". direction integer specifying direction order colors. default value 1, orders colors light dark. value -1 orders colors dark light. aesthetics character string specifying aesthetics modify. default value "". Valid options include "fill", "color", "".

title: Modify color aesthetics for categorical plots ‚Äî cat_modify_color
text: manual scale list manual scales color /fill   aesthetics using generated colors.

title: Modify color aesthetics for categorical plots ‚Äî cat_modify_color
code: library(catplot)  cat_modify_color(palette = "Set1", n = 3, aesthetics = "fill") #> <ggproto object: Class ScaleDiscrete, Scale, gg> #>     aesthetics: fill #>     axis_order: function #>     break_info: function #>     break_positions: function #>     breaks: waiver #>     call: call #>     clone: function #>     dimension: function #>     drop: TRUE #>     expand: waiver #>     get_breaks: function #>     get_breaks_minor: function #>     get_labels: function #>     get_limits: function #>     guide: legend #>     is_discrete: function #>     is_empty: function #>     labels: waiver #>     limits: NULL #>     make_sec_title: function #>     make_title: function #>     map: function #>     map_df: function #>     n.breaks.cache: NULL #>     na.translate: TRUE #>     na.value: grey50 #>     name: waiver #>     palette: function #>     palette.cache: NULL #>     position: left #>     range: environment #>     rescale: function #>     reset: function #>     scale_name: manual #>     train: function #>     train_df: function #>     transform: function #>     transform_df: function #>     super:  <ggproto object: Class ScaleDiscrete, Scale, gg> cat_modify_color(   palette = "Dark2",   n = 3,   color_names = c("A", "B", "C"),   direction = -1,   aesthetics = "color" ) #> <ggproto object: Class ScaleDiscrete, Scale, gg> #>     aesthetics: colour #>     axis_order: function #>     break_info: function #>     break_positions: function #>     breaks: waiver #>     call: call #>     clone: function #>     dimension: function #>     drop: TRUE #>     expand: waiver #>     get_breaks: function #>     get_breaks_minor: function #>     get_labels: function #>     get_limits: function #>     guide: legend #>     is_discrete: function #> what: Modify factor levels of data ‚Äî cat_modify_data
title: Modify factor levels of data ‚Äî cat_modify_data
text: function used adjust factor levels data based x_order y_order inputs.

title: Modify factor levels of data ‚Äî cat_modify_data
code: cat_modify_data(data, x, y, x_order = NULL, y_order = NULL)

title: Modify factor levels of data ‚Äî cat_modify_data
text: data data frame modified. x column name data frame adjusted factor levels. y column name data frame adjusted factor levels. x_order Optional. character vector specifying adjust factor levels x column. can one following: "desc" (arrange descending order according mean value), "asc" (arrange ascending order according mean value), vector factor levels desired order, NULL (change). y_order Optional. character vector specifying adjust factor levels y column. can one following: "desc" (arrange descending order according mean value), "asc" (arrange ascending order according mean value), vector factor levels desired order, NULL (change).

title: Modify factor levels of data ‚Äî cat_modify_data
text: modified data frame adjusted factor levels.

title: Modify factor levels of data ‚Äî cat_modify_data
code: library(catplot) data(iris) head(cat_modify_data(   data = iris,   x = Species,   y = Sepal.Length,   x_order =     c("virginica", "versicolor", "setosa") )) #>   Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species #> 1          5.1         3.5          1.4         0.2  setosa #> 2          4.9         3.0          1.4         0.2  setosa #> 3          4.7         3.2          1.3         0.2  setosa #> 4          4.6         3.1          1.5         0.2  setosa #> 5          5.0         3.6          1.4         0.2  setosa #> 6          5.4         3.9          1.7         0.4  setosa head(cat_modify_data(   data = iris,   x = Species,   y = Sepal.Length,   x_order = "desc" )) #>   Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species #> 1          5.1         3.5          1.4         0.2  setosa #> 2          4.9         3.0          1.4         0.2  setosa #> 3          4.7         3.2          1.3         0.2  setosa #> 4          4.6         3.1          1.5         0.2  setosa #> 5          5.0         3.6          1.4         0.2  setosa #> 6          5.4         3.9          1.7         0.4  setosa

what:
Modify a ggplot2 plot with custom theme, title, axis labels, and ggsignif
comparisons ‚Äî cat_modify_plot
title:
Modify a ggplot2 plot with custom theme, title, axis labels, and ggsignif
comparisons ‚Äî cat_modify_plot
text: function modifies ggplot2 plot adding custom theme, plot title, axis labels, ggsignif comparisons. function returns list ggplot2 objects can used modify plot.

title:
Modify a ggplot2 plot with custom theme, title, axis labels, and ggsignif
comparisons ‚Äî cat_modify_plot
code: cat_modify_plot(   plot_title = waiver(),   x_axis_title = waiver(),   y_axis_title = waiver(),   x_text_angle = NULL,   y_text_angle = NULL,   legend_title = waiver(),   font_size = 8,   linewidth = 0.5,   aspect_ratio = NULL,   frame = "closed",   show_panel_grid = "both_not",   show_title = "both",   show_text = "both",   text_italic = "both_not",   show_ticks = "both",   ticks_length = 4,   legend_position = "right",   legend_direction = NULL,   comparisons = NULL,   test = "wilcox.test",   step_increase = 0.1,   map_signif_level = TRUE )

title:
Modify a ggplot2 plot with custom theme, title, axis labels, and ggsignif
comparisons ‚Äî cat_modify_plot
text: plot_title character string representing title plot x_axis_title character string representing title x-axis y_axis_title character string representing title y-axis x_text_angle integer representing angle x-axis text labels y_text_angle integer representing angle y-axis text labels legend_title character string representing title plot legend font_size Numeric, font size (default: 8) linewidth Numeric, line width (default: 0.5) aspect_ratio Numeric, aspect ratio plot (default: NULL) frame Character, frame type, "closed" "open" (default: "closed") show_panel_grid Character, panel grid visibility (default: "both_not") show_title Character, axis title visibility (default: "") show_text Character, axis text visibility (default: "") text_italic Character, axis text italicization (default: "both_not") show_ticks Character, axis tick visibility (default: "") ticks_length Numeric, tick length (default: 4) legend_position Character, position legend (default: "right") legend_direction Character, direction legend (default: NULL) comparisons list comparison groups ggsignif test character string representing statistical test use ggsignif step_increase numeric value representing step increase ggsignif map_signif_level logical value representing whether map significance level ggsignif

title:
Modify a ggplot2 plot with custom theme, title, axis labels, and ggsignif
comparisons ‚Äî cat_modify_plot
text: list ggplot2 objects can used modify plot

title:
Modify a ggplot2 plot with custom theme, title, axis labels, and ggsignif
comparisons ‚Äî cat_modify_plot
code: library(ggplot2) library(catplot)  # Create a plot data(mtcars) p <-   ggplot(mtcars, aes(     x = factor(cyl),     y = mpg,     fill = factor(gear)   )) +   geom_boxplot() +   labs(     title = "Miles per Gallon by Cylinder and Gear",     x = "Cylinder",     y = "Miles per Gallon",     fill = "Gear"   )  # Modify the plot with custom theme, title, and axis labels p + cat_modify_plot(   plot_title = "Miles per Gallon by Cylinder and Gear",   x_axis_title = "Cylinder",   y_axis_title = "Miles per Gallon" )   # Modify the plot with custom ggsignif comparisons p + cat_modify_plot(   comparisons = list(c("4", "6"), c("4", "8"), c("6", "8")),   test = "t.test" )   # Modify the plot with custom theme and ggsignif comparisons p + cat_modify_plot(   font_size = 12,   linewidth = 1,   comparisons = list(c("4", "6"), c("4", "8"), c("6", "8")),   test = "t.test" )

what: Save a ggplot object to a file ‚Äî cat_save
title: Save a ggplot object to a file ‚Äî cat_save
text: function saves ggplot object file. provides option save raw data used create plot separate CSV file.

title: Save a ggplot object to a file ‚Äî cat_save
code: cat_save(   filename,   plot = last_plot(),   device = NULL,   path = NULL,   scale = 1,   width = NA,   height = NA,   units = c("in", "cm", "mm", "px"),   dpi = 300,   limitsize = TRUE,   bg = NULL,   source_data = FALSE,   ... )

title: Save a ggplot object to a file ‚Äî cat_save
text: filename character string specifying name file save plot plot ggplot object saved device character string specifying graphics device use path character string specifying directory save file scale numeric value specifying scaling factor plot width numeric value specifying width plot height numeric value specifying height plot units character string specifying units width height arguments dpi numeric value specifying resolution plot limitsize logical value specifying whether limit size plot device size bg character string specifying background color plot source_data logical value specifying whether save raw data used create plot separate CSV file ... Additional arguments passed ggsave

what: Create a directory if it does not exist and return the path ‚Äî cat_set_path

code: cat_set_path(path)

title: Create a directory if it does not exist and return the path ‚Äî cat_set_path
text: path character string specifying path created.

title: Create a directory if it does not exist and return the path ‚Äî cat_set_path
text: character string specifying path.

code: cat_set_path("~/my_folder") #> [1] "~/my_folder"

what: Plot a violin plot with categorical groups ‚Äî cat_vlnplot
title: Plot a violin plot with categorical groups ‚Äî cat_vlnplot
text: function plots violin plot categorical groups using VlnPlot function Seurat package.

title: Plot a violin plot with categorical groups ‚Äî cat_vlnplot
code: cat_vlnplot(   object,   features,   pt_size = 0,   sort = FALSE,   group_by = NULL,   split_by = NULL,   show_legend = FALSE,   angle_x = 0,   aspect_ratio = 0.5 )

title: Plot a violin plot with categorical groups ‚Äî cat_vlnplot
text: object Seurat object containing data plot. features character vector feature names plot. pt_size size points plot. sort Whether sort features mean expression . group_by character vector specifying grouping variable. Defaults "ident". split_by character vector specifying splitting variable. show_legend Whether show legend . Defaults FALSE. angle_x angle x-axis labels. Defaults 0. aspect_ratio aspect ratio plot. Defaults 0.5.

title: Plot a violin plot with categorical groups ‚Äî cat_vlnplot
text: ggplot2 object.

title: Plot a violin plot with categorical groups ‚Äî cat_vlnplot
code: if (FALSE) { cat_vlnplot(object = mySeuratObject, features = c("CD3D", "CD8A", "CD4")) }

text: logical value indicating whether input string valid color   value.

title: Check if a string is a valid color value ‚Äî .is_color
code: catplot:::.is_color("red") # returns TRUE #> [1] TRUE catplot:::.is_color("#FFA500") # returns TRUE #> [1] TRUE catplot:::.is_color("fdafd") # returns FALSE #> [1] FALSE

title: Generate a color palette ‚Äî generate_colors
text: function generates color palette based input parameters.

title: Generate a color palette ‚Äî generate_colors
code: generate_colors(   palette = NULL,   n = NULL,   color_names = NULL,   modification = NULL,   view_palette = TRUE,   view_labels = TRUE )

title: Generate a color palette ‚Äî generate_colors
text: palette character string specifying name color palette use. default value "default". Valid options include "default", "hue", "grey", "gray", "brewer", "ggsci". n integer specifying number colors generate. default value NULL, generates default number colors based selected palette. color_names character vector specifying names individual colors palette. length vector number colors palette. default value NULL, assign names colors. modification character string specifying modification apply colors. default value "go_lighter". Valid options include "go_darker", "go_lighter", "go_both_ways". view_palette logical value indicating whether display generated color palette. default value TRUE. view_labels logical value indicating whether display labels colors generated palette. default value TRUE.

title: Generate a color palette ‚Äî generate_colors
text: vector colors, element representing color   generated palette.

title: Generate a color palette ‚Äî generate_colors
code: generate_colors(palette = "default", n = 5)  #> [1] "#F8766DFF" "#A3A500FF" "#00BF7DFF" "#00B0F6FF" "#E76BF3FF" generate_colors(palette = "Paired", n = 8, view_palette = FALSE) #> [1] "#A6CEE3" "#1F78B4" "#B2DF8A" "#33A02C" "#FB9A99" "#E31A1C" "#FDBF6F" #> [8] "#FF7F00" generate_colors(   palette = "npg",   n = 3,   color_names = c("red", "blue", "green"),   view_labels = FALSE )  #>         red        blue       green  #> "#E64B35FF" "#4DBBD5FF" "#00A087FF"

title: Custom theme for catplot ‚Äî theme_cat
text: Custom theme catplot

title: Custom theme for catplot ‚Äî theme_cat
code: theme_cat(   font_size = 8,   linewidth = 0.5,   aspect_ratio = NULL,   frame = "closed",   show_panel_grid = "both_not",   show_title = "both",   show_text = "both",   text_italic = "both_not",   show_ticks = "both",   ticks_length = 4,   legend_position = "right",   legend_direction = NULL )

title: Custom theme for catplot ‚Äî theme_cat
text: font_size Numeric, font size (default: 8) linewidth Numeric, line width (default: 0.5) aspect_ratio Numeric, aspect ratio plot (default: NULL) frame Character, frame type, "closed" "open" (default: "closed") show_panel_grid Character, panel grid visibility (default: "both_not") show_title Character, axis title visibility (default: "") show_text Character, axis text visibility (default: "") text_italic Character, axis text italicization (default: "both_not") show_ticks Character, axis tick visibility (default: "") ticks_length Numeric, tick length (default: 4) legend_position Character, position legend (default: "right") legend_direction Character, direction legend (default: NULL)

title: Custom theme for catplot ‚Äî theme_cat
text: ggplot2 theme

title: Custom theme for catplot ‚Äî theme_cat
code: library(catplot) library(ggplot2)  p <- ggplot(mpg, aes(x = manufacturer, y = hwy)) +   geom_point() p + theme_cat()
